comments.content: Find #1: [http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/ceres/ehoc/billingsley/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504031534/http:/www.english.cam.ac.uk/ceres/ehoc/billingsley/ "http://www.english.cam.ac.uk/ceres/ehoc/billingsley/") (might need to dig a bit)
James Mosley has written about him as well in one of the Typo Papers.
Jon Coltz used to have a write-up on Cresci which included an image which I can longer get to load.

The Trajan column inscription was masterfully rendered thank to G.F. Cresci  
and Luca Pacioli’s drawings. Cresci arrived in Rome from Milan on 1550;  
six years later was nomined “Scriptor Latinus” of the Library, and on 1560,  
keeping his appointment, calligrapher for the Cappella Sistina, the time  
he publish is writing book “Il Perfetto Scrittore”.

Regards,  
AS
